metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29539 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When handling the filename directive in the Content-Disposition header, thefilename would be truncated if the filename contained a NULL character.This could have led to reflected file download attacks potentially trickingusers to install malware. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112, Focusfor Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112, andThunderbird < 102.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
